config.question: What was one major principle of the doctrine of pragmatism?

choices.content: The truth is made up of ideas that work out.
Morality is subjective and every man is immoral.
All incidents in life are ordained by a divine will.
Capitalism is immoral and inimical to public interest.

answer_3.response: A new doctrine called pragmatism, based on dealing with things practically to see if they worked, emerged in this ferment of ideas. It came from William James, a brilliant Harvard psychologist who became the key figure in American thought from the 1890s to World War I.
